favourite.article: One of my favorites, the words and the music, beautiful melody, true, true words. I'm using it again in a devotion next week.

Many a times we cast our hearts in the midst of despair..a time like this this song comes to my mind which each word penned down that day by He holds my hand and since He promised I will keep on going forward.

I thank each of your for testimony of our Lord's faithfulness to you in your trials. It has been the same with me over my lifetime and especially in these most recent years, even through a rare and dangerous cancer, stage 3c. Your words of hope, strength and comfort have blessed me beyond words. I was once a church organist, and I know this blessed hymn well. And I have lived it, too, along with you. Lord Jesus, please keep us close to your precious side through it all.

I just sang this to my sweet mom who has Alzheimer's & in the hospital because she started having seizures. This is a scary place for her and she's desperately missing the love of her life for 61 years because my dad had a stroke 2 weeks ago. He is in a rehab center miles from here desperately missing her. They used to sing this together in church when I was growing up. Tomorrow when I go see my dad I will sing it to him. We serve an awesome God who blessed my life with these two wonderful parents & I am trusting Him for their future & changes that lay ahead. I hope this also encourages anyone who reads this. Time & time again my Lord has never forsaken me during the unknown paths of my life...and He never will.

I remember a Wednesday evening in April ten years ago that I sang that song in a midweek prayer service at a church in Ohio. Two days later, my life literally feel apart when my wife left me, which had the effect of thrusting me wholly on the Lord. The song always had deep meaning to me, as many times in the past, God has been there for me. You never know that God is all you need until God is all you have. Since that night of calamity, I have gone through the dark night of the soul over and over again as God has brought me through trial after trial, a heart transplant, End Stage Kidney Disease and yet He touched me again and again with His loving and healing heart; a heart that is kind beyond all measure.

I thank the Lord out Savior today for hearing this song and knowing that I'm not alone and not the only one going thru trouble. My wife and I are worried for about 3 years for our oldest boy. He has been in the wrong path. We have worry, cry and blame each other, but we have heard from Christian brothers never, never stop Praying for him. We praise the Lord, His is The Glory, and He does work in ways that we don't always know.

The Lord led me to this song, this morning, after a couple of nights of muscle spasms and anxiety and I'm relieved in the comfort of these awesome lyrics. Praise God from Whom all blessings flow. @ T. Benton. And others, Do not be discouraged. Keep trusting. Christ still knocks on the door of the heart, and as long as it beats, there is hope. God bless.
Dear T. Benton, I was moved by your comment. I am praying for you and your son.

My daddy is a Baptist minister and we've sung this hymn as a duet together since before I was in high school and many years into my adulthood. I know it by memory. I'm hurting so deeply tonight for our 16 year old son who has taken the wrong path and is self-destructing before our eyes. None of our efforts, over 2 years, have helped. I feel lost and hopeless, even as a strong believer. As I found myself at my piano tonight, flipping through the great hymns, I come to Day by Day. I play through, lifting my voice to God, each verse speaking deeply to my heart and ministering to my brokenness. Of all the many times I've sung, this is the first time I've truly listened to the message. The words brought so much comfort, so much peace. I hope it finds it's way to others who's hearts are breaking and in need of a mighty, all-powerful God.

Such an awesome God we have and what comforting lyrics!!I am in my deepest gloom away from my husband since 2 years and God is only near to me. I have no hope in him but only in God. He has abandoned me and doesn't want to come back to me. I have not been able to read Bible and pray for longer time as my soul is weary and the only best thing that has helped me is listening and singing to hymns of worship and comfort and knowing that I am not alone even in my solitude. He is alive and is with me in every passing moment. All Glory to our eternal God in Christ Jesus.

I'm grieving deeply at the moment and am in a very dark place where I can't even pray or read God's Word. The darkest and silence is deafening. But just as I was waking early this morning, God brought this beautiful hymn to my mind that I haven't heard in years and I knew I just had to find the words and try and sing it. So I found it here and cried my eyes out. Then, as I've read other comments, I've realized that God has worked in much the same way in many lives. People who are in deep pain, God comes to gently in the dark night of the soul and whispers to us to listen to this song as a beautiful reminder of us constant love and care.

I accepted her back with open heart and arms after 2yrs 11 mths and then she left again and almost died in an accident. My help comes the Lord. This song has been my guiding light and comfort for the last month but more so since October 26 when she almost died in the accident. "Help me then, in every tribulation, So to trust Thy promises, O Lord, That I lose not faith’s sweet consolation, Offered me within Thy holy Word. Help me, Lord, when toil and trouble meeting, E’er to take, as from a father’s hand, One by one, the days, the moments fleeting, Till with Christ the Lord I stand".

This song hasbeen very helpful in time deep spiritual battle but I know that my Lord and Saviour, Jesus Christ is ever near me. Yesterday Sunday, October 11, 2015 I played it all day and today I am playing again. I am in a spiritual warfare but I have to put on all the whole amour "Trusting in my Father’s wise bestowment, I’ve no cause for worry or for fear. He, whose heart is kind beyond all measure, Gives unto each day what He deems best,"
The protection of His child and treasure Is a charge that on Himself He laid; “As thy days, thy strength shall be in measure,” This the pledge to me He made.
With Christ the Lord we stand! Amen!

I love this song, so sweet , so lovely, and comforting. In time of sorrow, pain, troubles, reminding me "How Great my Lord, my Savior, "Every day the Lord Himself is near me, With a special mercy for each hour;" What a beautiful Savior I have!!! I have no worry at all!!! Hallelujah...

Great song!!! "Trusting in my Father’s wise bestowment, I’ve no cause for worry or for fear." Even death has no strength because He is with us, He died for that, to give us sweet consolation offered for free within His Holy Word. O Jesus my Saviour, I love You The melody is so sweet like a soft murmur!!! Thank you for this song.
Lovely song.
This song ministers to my soul.

This precious old hymn has been such a blessing since my husband was diagnosed with stage 3 colon cancer a few months ago. "Day by day, and with each passing moment, Strength I find to meet my trials here; Trusting in my Father’s wise bestowment, I’ve no cause for worry or for fear. He, whose heart is kind beyond all measure,... As thy days, thy strength shall be in measure,” This the pledge to me He made. Gives unto each day what HE deems best.

I remember this hymn most keenly when I was a teenaged girl and my heart was broken over a betrayal. As I walked in the rain I sang this song over and over, and it soothed my soul. It has a way of settling your heart in being reminded that The Lord will use every circumstance in our lives for good, if we have yielded our hearts to Him. Then our suffering can be for His glory, even if the reason we are in it is due to our own sin. To God be the glory!

I love this Swedish melody from the pen of Caolina Sandell Berg. I introduce this song to our Male Quartet called "ONE VOICE" and they love the music and the words of this song. Before we sing we always tell the story behind the song. I associated this melody with 2 Corinthian 4:16.
I sing Bass and ad lib up and down the scale to make my part more interesting - just like Bass notes of the piano.Thank you for your Ministry!
Sang this in church with my 100-year-old dad. He had all three verses memorized; I did not.
One song that brings peace, love and satisfaction to life and its joys.
Very melodic and impressive song.
The song I never tired to say.
What a hymn... Day by day... I love it day by day.
This is a very beautiful hymn; one which has helped me in times of trial to see the Light and cling to the cross; to get my focus on Him who is indeed Counselor and Power.
This song just saved my life. Beautiful melody to enhance a wonderful prayer. It uplifted my spirit and gave me a new reason to go on living. It now is "well with my soul".

This song melts my heart, and I can listen to it and listen to it and listen to it, It restores, strengthens, and encourages me, Thank you, for putting the words for me to see. I could not find my hymnal.
Thank you for posting this song. It has been a helped to me in times of cares. It is evident that God has used this in my own personal life to continue to trust His care for me.

Wow!!!!! This song has really touched my heart....the words are so powerful....day by day I'll sing this song coz the word are sure and true...topping my list of favourites.....Let's keep on with the ministry of Christ because they that wait upon the Lord, shall renew their strength, they shall mount up with wings as eagles...
Karolina's song has touched the core of my being. I could never get tired of listening to it. God bless you for putting it on the internet.
May The Lord be praised forever. I cry each time I sing this amazing hymn. Thank you for this ministry.
Soul lifted woship song.
I love that you put hymns on here. This one is so pressing! Thank you.

I took Lynne R's 2/25/2012 recommendation and bought the book. It has been a blessing. I look forward to waking up each moring to sing a new hymn. And I usually do not like daily devotionals.
Lynne shared a little of the story behind the hymn. Here's more: Carolina Sandell Berg was never strong as a child, so she spent much time in her father's study and grew especially close to him. When she was 26, she accompanied her father, who was a parish pastor in Froderyd, Sweden on a voyage to Goteborg. As they stood on deck, the boat lurched and spilled Pastor Sandell overboard. The crew was unable to save him, and he drowned as his daughter looked on. Berg was already well known for hymns she had published as a young girl, but this tragedy inspired many more. - Great Songs of Faith by Brown & Norton

Someone from my church had shared with our church. This was when she was battling cancer, and my mom was battling breast cancer as well. I now found this site while I am trying to share it with my friend for her to share with her church while they now have a 22 year old battling Leukemia. This song is so true, I love the lyrics. Thank you for having this here for everyone to enjoy!

I like this song very much because it strengthens me. I want my daughter to sing this song in the church but no script. At last I've found the script! Thanks a lot. May your service to the Lord and mankind be a blessing to you and all.

I do declare today that this is a new favorite hymn of mine! The words are so comforting and practical, and the melody so sweet and easy to remember. I'm drawn to its Scandinavian roots since I am Norwegian. I hope it is a blessing to you too! :)

This is such a beautiful hymn and the prayer of my heart today. I thought of my parents' memorial service last year and wept as I listened to this. Thank You Jesus for Your love for us and giving us the faith to carry on.

I recently had a leg amputated with months in the hospital, rehab and now home rehab. While on the exercise machines, I thought of the words of this song over and over (along with "My Faith Has Found a Resting Place" and verses from the first chapter of James).
As a testimony to God's grace, He has kept me and my family from anger, bitterness, depression, envy of others or confusion. Knowing that "the protection of His child and treasure is a charge that on Himself He laid" got me through many lonely times, but never has He let my faith waver (for His glory). "Day by Day" is such a well-worded and solidly biblical expression that I have sung for years, but now means more to me now more than ever.

My little sister called today and shared this song with me. I have been ill for over 11 years and getting weaker. I have been broken a couple of times over these years. I have found out of weakness. He is my strength. The words that Lina wrote are so true and she could have only known them as truth... by the life of God's Son in her through the Holy Spirit. To trust our Lord's promises. We see His kindness, love, mercy and nearness to us. I love what she says about, "All my cares He wants to bear to cheer me." She could not have found what she did in Christ, during the death of her Dad, apart from God's revealing love, grace and kindness for her. It is encouraging to know what we are like apart from God's grace. Because then; He is the One who gets the glory because we know it's not of us. This will be a favorite song for me now.

This Song was my Mother's favorite. When she left Sweden to India as a Missionary and later she adopted 16 children: 9 boys and 7 girls she Became God's Gift of Mother to all of us. She has gone Home to be with Jesus. I'am Thankful to God for Giving us the Best Mother and Best Missionary to India. Thank You Lord Jesus. Please pray for me and I won't be alone. This song was my Mother's song. I love You Jesus.

As I was praying for a friend whose sister was diagnosed with cancer and given only weeks to live, The Holy Spirit brought this song to mind to share with them and pray it for them. I am so grateful to our Lord and Savior, and our Heavenly Father.

There's a Great Songs of Faith Devotion by Robert Brown & Mark Norton ISBN1-4143-0699-7 which tells the stories behing the hymns (Iread then come to this site to listen. Carolina Sandall witnessed her Pastor father as the ship lurched and he fell overboard during a voyage in Sweden. They were unable to rescue him in time and she lost someone very close to her. She wrote many hymns and persisted through trials in faith.

The Lord put this song on my heart yesterday. I've known it for many years, and have found much comfort from it. However, sometimes we forget about some of the old hymns, with today's modern worship music. With two prodigal children and many needs within our life group, the timing was perfect. All I could do was bawl, as I sang out before the Lord this morning. Our God is good and doeth good.

The Bible says He will give us songs in the night. This song was given to me in the early hours this morning. I came to this site to check out all the words. What a blessing they give as my daughter is battling breast cancer.

Oh how I wish we we were still singing these old hymns in the church today. It is increasingly hard to find a church that will sing the 'oldies' the way they were originally written. I've learned to sing How Great Thou Art in a totally new tempo and it still brings tears to my eyes. I heard a comment about the choruses we sing today. They are 7/11 hymns; seven words sung eleven times.

I love piano. I am a great grandmother with a total of one year worth of piano lessons. I love this tune. I wish someone would let me know where to send away for this sheet music, and the cost. I would be glad to send the money, you could send the paid (in advance) sheet music. Either way, please let me know?
Amazing hymn. So glad I found this site and song just when I needed it most!
Inspiring song. Fall in love with it over and over again. God bless you.
This song says it all; it reminds me how good, gracious and giving God is and that He is and will always be with me as this is His promise to me.

I was reading in Hebrews 11 about the saints and their faith to meet each trial with strength from Him. This song came to mind. What a blessing it is to read these comments and to know that we all share this same faith and are given His strength to live life Day by Day.
I am always encouraged and strengthened by this soul-inspiring hymn. God, please carry on to be Our LIFE and LIGHT in this DEAD and DARKENED world.
We sang this song in church today. The words really touched my heart. Even in the midst of our trials, He is always here.
One of the most precious spiritual songs that God gave me after I was saved by the awesome grace of God. I wish I learnt the words by heart and kept singing it all through the day.

Precious words!! Some of my earliest memories are of my parents singing this as a duet. Everyone who knows them attaches this song to them. They have sung it for years. This last year has been so terribly difficult for them...for us. Yet the truth of this song shines bright in the midst of the storm, bringing comfort and hope. Thank you mom and dad for living and singing His truths.

The Lord brought this melody to me a few times recently, then today I heard it sung on the radio, so felt He was trying to give me a message. On your website I was able to read the lyrics and see the message He had for me. Thank you for providing this service.

This song came as a reminder of God's word to me in a time of trials. "Everyday the Lord Himself is near me," is the sweetest words of protection that I have ever heard. Thanks and praises to Jehovah Jireh.
The Lord used this song to touch and bless me today to remind me of the depth of His love and care for me now and always. How good and kind He is to us.

I have listened to this song so many times, and cried as I sang along playing it in my car, this time it just came to mind that I should sing it on my birthday, Aug 21, 2011 for my congregation, what can one do to acknowledge the woderful mercies of God. Sing praises, so encouraging, I am going to give it my all.

It is a beautiful song. I will be using it this afternoon as a Prayer for our ship as it gets underway. The music, words and translation are all done by early founders of the Evangelical Covenant Church. It is still around today and growing. If there is one near you please check them out. They have been described as a "Denomination that fights above it's weight class" (a metaphor for the impact it has relative to it's size)
My husband is dying and it is a very trying time, this is a great comforting song.

I use to wake up crying. I know Christ since 1979. Good teaching, good songs. God gave me a special gift. When I was saying have a good day in a letter to my prison pen pal, this song started going through my mind. What a blessing!

My faith isn't what it once was, undying and unquestioning, but in a way I feel that is good. Contemplating the meaning of our universe and our role in it is part of the free will and free thinking gift we received at the time of creation. This coming Sunday my sister and I will sing this hymn for my grandmother. It was one of my late grandfather's favorites, and I know that the moment will be special for everyone.

This is my all time favorite hymn. We sing it often in the Lutheran Church where I am a member. I have it closely by me at my home office desk. My son recently died in an accident at the age of 26. We sang it at his funeral on Dec 22, 2010 just before Christmas. All attending were comforted by it. Hopefully everyone who hears it can find as much comfort in it as I have through the years and especially now as I grieve the death of my oldest son.

My dear late father, Lindsay Reynolds, taught us to sing this hymn together in the car on long trips when I was a little girl. We would all sing in parts, and Dad would be the organ- providing the bass. The memory, and the hymn has been a source of comfort and encouragement to for some fifty years now, as my strong and loving earthly father taught me to trust in the loving provision of my heavenly father, who will, in the end, make all things right. May He be your comfort.
The person who wrote this song wrote it with a broken heart, at the loss of a father. It's very beautiful, but even more so now that my heart is breaking.

I'm starting to write an SATB choral arrangement for my High School Chamber Choir students of this wonderful hymn! It has always been one of my favorites because of the rich theology and beautiful melody. I pray that the Lord will use it to bring many to a saving knowledge of Himself. Soli Deo Gloria!

We found this song page in my grandma's purse the day after she passed away. We had her funeral yesterday. She will be missed but now when I hear this song I can think of her and the message of this song.

The words of this song came to me during my devotion this morning and I could not remember everything; I googled and got to this site. Awesome! I only knew the first stanza. I'm going through challenging times as a survivor of domestic violence and now single mom, it's like Lord, how could I have avoided all this. I will visit here again & again to drink from this fountain. God bless you.

I have always known this was an amazing and very beautiful song. Recently it has really been helping me through some trials of my own. These trials will always be with us until we are with Christ. I have been very blessed to grow up around true Christians and around missionaries. I have friends that have died and put in prison in China and Indonesia for their faith. Let's never forget to pray for those we do not know that are facing persecution all over this world. We must be ready to face whatever God sees fit to bring our way and trust Him. Thank you to the one from Korea for the scripture reference. It blessed my heart. Acts 16:31, James 1:12....Let us be patient and trusting in God for one day we will mount up with wings as eagles! God bless all those who believe and who are seeking Him.
It is so unique and beautiful, it displays the wonderful attributes of God, the depth of His love and compassion of His towards us. I believe it is just as effective today as the day it was written.
This song has never been one of my favorites until now, because of the way it is played. So sweetly. Thank you, Hymnal.net!

I feel so lonely tonight; doing God's work alone in this city. One of my partner left me to do God's will, but I remember this song, and tonight I sing it with my Lord. I can feel that He is with me tonight, holding my hands and saying to not worry for everything ahead me. He's already proved it through all my life. Why shouldn't I trust Him now. Thank You my dear Lord.

This song has always been special to me and I just copied part of it to send to my daughter who has been going through some hard times. The phrase that has stuck with me most since I first heard it is "The protection of His child and treasure is a charge that on Himself he laid." What better place could we ever be than the hands of our Almighty Loving Heavenly Father?

I like this song because of its wonderful melody. The text contains very deep truths of our Christian faith. The Lord really knows our necessities and He also helps us when we're going through the dark lonesome valley. This song should be sung in every church around this world.
This song my dad has whistled and sung for years. He was a missionarry for over 30 years in West Africa, and it met his heart's needs. A lot of missionary friends of his love this song.
This is one of the most beautifully written songs I have ever heard. I wish more churches would bring hymns into their type of worship, for many reasons. All positive reasons. I love this song!

The hymns hold me up and keep me joyful during weary days. How I thank God for the fellowship we share with these brothers and sisters who wrote down and published the poems of their hearts. Thank you for this website. In His unfailing love, Ann

This hymn is so special. It ministers to me in the deep places. Praise God for the gift of the hymns of the church. They meet the need of my soul each and every day!!! God's Peace and Good Journey!!! HBAlex
This song really uplifts my confidence today. Lets be assured that God indeed will meet all our needs, both material and spiritual things. Jeremiah 29:11.

I first heard this song many years ago as a young man. It has echoed in my mind in fragments but I never forgot many of the verses. I am not a church going Christian anymore and I question many things about Christianity. However I still love the Spirit of God. This song is better than a lot of sermons I've ever heard and it still touches my heart ever so warmly.
"Every day the Lord Himself is near me, With a special mercy for EACH hour." Praise God! His children NEVER walk alone. Truly He has said He will never leave us nor forsake us (Hebrews 13:5).

I heard this song on a Gaither tape and was moved more than usual. For twenty-nine years, I have faced an unusual journey with the mental illness of my brother. Along with some other trials, I was ready to give up, but when I heard this song, I printed it off and framed it.
In bold print and underlined are the words, "As thy days, thy strength shall be in measure," This is the pledge to me He made.
Now I am printing it and enclosing it to a dear friend, Ed Minor, who is suffering more than I can describe from the problems of radiation on his kidneys. Ed and Mary Ann, his wife, are inspirations to all who visit, but the doctors need a miracle to stop all these infections or we ask that God provide the physicians with needed knowledge.
This song is beautiful and comforting. Thank you for sharing it with me. Praise God!!
This song is really helping me right now. Going though things each day reminds me He is by my side. What a sweet Saviour!!!
This hymn exhibits life-changing text for me and my family. Also, the music corresponds to add to the effect and affect of the words. I love it and am in touch with it daily. I love the Lord.

This song was given to us by a cousin after my wife was diagnosed with breast cancer. We sang it when she was anointed for healing. Blessed be God our Father whose heart is kind beyond all understanding!
It comforts us: "in all our tribulations, that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble, by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God." (2 Cor. 1:4)
The assurance that 'the protection of His child and treasure is a CHARGE that upon Himself He laid' is all I need to know.

No matter how difficult my trial I am reminded that it will never be more than I can bear, nor is it outside of God's sovereign plan for my life; in fact, trials exhibit God's love in a miraculous way. These truths bring great comfort in the midst of my sorrow, strength in my weakness, and hope in my despair.

The English words to Day By Day were written by a relative of mine. Andrew L. Skoog was my grandmother's cousin. He was the organist and choir director at the First Covenant Church in Minneapolis. He also served on the Minneapolis City Council. He wrote and translated hundreds of hymns from Swedish to English. Day By Day is our family's unofficial Famiy Hymn.
The first time I heard this song was about 15 years ago. It came back to my mind tonight as I was praying. May we continue to find strength in Him.
As 2009 begins this is my song for the year - not just a song but a prayer that I may trust God - Day By Day.
It tells of God's love and grace to a fallen people like myself. It makes me remember to seek His face each moment; in joy or troubles.
What a wonderful hymn!
It tells me of a Saviour's love...gives me such joy that I always have shed tears of gladness at each singing or hearing.

This song implies the real and personal relationship of a human being to the Almighty God, Creator of the universe. What a wonderful thought and truth to believe, to believe that He is right in the middle of every detail of my life, day by day.

I have loved this song for many years (probably 35), but more so since my husband went to be with the Lord three years ago. This song reminds me depend on the Lord moment by moment and day by day. It is such an encouraging song that reminds me that no matter how difficult things may be come, God and His grace will always be there for me to draw from.

This song has been a real comfort and blessing to me since my husband went home to be with our Lord and Saviour last month. I have known this hymn from childhood and often find myself humming or sing it.
I love this song so much. It's my best hymn! It restores my faith and brightens up my day every time I sing it or listen to it.

To know the Lord and then become lukewarm can be very difficult. When I found my way back to a life of total surrender to the Lord this song was an absolute rock, a constant guide in my spiritual journey.
When facing uncertain times I can trust the One who knows and holds the future. Praise the name of Jesus!
Beautiful memories of my Swedish upbringing and childhood!
I am so blessed with this song, what a mighty God we have in our lives. I pray that everyone in this world to know HIM personally, so that this song may be real in their lives. God Bless All!!!
yes, He whose heart is kind beyond all measure. amen

I heard and sang this song every assembly during high school. At that moment, i still not yet believed in Lord but felt very peaceful wheneven i sang it. now, god take my hand, this song always comes to my mind and i feel so joyful and in peace.
It calms and gives me confidence whenever troubled thoughts come into my mind. I would like to have the sheet music for this song, but I cannot find it in my church hymnal book.

In times of trial or blessing this has been my favorite song. One that I know by heart. I find myself humming the tune often. One by one, the days,the moments fleeting... until I take my Fathers hand...
One of my all time favs.
This is so beautiful. Thanks for sharing
